channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-14406] The dataframe datasource filter is wrong, and will result in data loss or unexpected behavior
item.description:
Following condition will result in the same filter. It will have data loss with the current filter construction.
col1 > 4 && col2 < 3
col1 > 4 || col2 < 3
item.summary: The dataframe datasource filter is wrong, and will result in data loss or unexpected behavior

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment:
Following condition will result in the same filter. It will have data loss with the current filter construction.
col1 > 4 && col2 < 3
col1 > 4 || col2 < 3

Ted Malaska
Ted Malaska's response
On one you 100% right. We're good if we have one RowKey filter and one Column Filter or multiple column filters that are and joined. But an or on two different columns will cause rows to be wrongly filtered.

It is quite common in sql query there are filters on multiple columns.

Zhan Zhang:
I copied your 1st comment to description.
It is good practice to give people good summary.

Thank again for finding this. Sorry for missing this in the code.

Let me know if you want to make the patch, or if someone else would like to make the patch. If not I have time early next week.

Thanks again.

Let me know if anyone would like to do this. If not I plan to take it on monday.

I think I have a solution in my head. Should take a day or so to code up.

Cool going to started tonight.

Thanks aafri zhang

Made really good progress today. There is about 4 more hours of work left.

So hopefully in the next day or so.

First draft.

1. Added full support for dynamic logic to be pushed down in the scan's filter
2. Added the ability to turn on or off the push down filter functionality
3. Added a bunch of tests

@Ted:
Are you adding more tests ?

I will go over the review board one more time.

Sorry Hadoop World took me out of commition for awhile, but I'm back now.

I looked at the review board. I don't see anything else to add. What else has to happen to close this jira out. I have the whole week to focus on this jira.

@Ted:
I will review one more time.
Have your tests covered the following clause ?

where rowkey < 1 and col > 2

where rowkey < 1 or col > 3

I think the bug from last time was the following two

( rowkey < 1 or col > 2 )

and

( colA < 1 or colB > 2 )

The functionality of (rowkey < 1 and col > 2) worked in the last patch

But here are some related tests that should cover both cases
test("Test SQL point and range combo")
test("Test OR logic with a one RowKey and One column")
test("Test two complete range non merge rowKey query")
test("Test OR logic with a two columns")

Ted Malaska

Can you add a test case as
val results = sqlContext.sql("SELECT KEY_FIELD, B_FIELD, A_FIELD FROM hbaseTable1 " +
"WHERE " +
"( KEY_FIELD >= 'get4' or A_FIELD <= 'foo2') ).take(10)
Zhan Zhang np. Lets me add it now. It will take hopefully less then an hour.
Applied worked for Zhan Zhang and Ted Yu
Then to Than

Hmm let me research how it is done in the unit tests in Spark core and I will try to do the same.

This message is automatically generated.

That last issue looks to be outside of the Spark code. Looks to be something wrong with the HBaseTestingUtility in the build environment. I've ran these test a dozen times today through the following command and have not seen this issue.

cd hbase-spark
mvn -Dtest=NoUnitTests clean verify

What are the options to resolve this issue?

I agree the cause might be in hbase core.

However under hbase-spark/target/surefire-reports/ , I only found:


ls ~/trunk/hbase-spark/target/surefire-reports/

TEST-org.apache.hadoop.hbase.spark.DynamicLogicExpressionSuite.xml	TestSuite.txt

TEST-org.apache.hadoop.hbase.spark.HBaseDStreamFunctionsSuite.xml

Do you know where I can find the log corresponding to the period when HBaseContextSuite ran ?

HBaseTestingUtility is used in all the following test suites:

  • BulkLoadSuite
  • DefaultSourceSuite
  • HBaseContextSuite
  • HBaseDStreamFunctionsSuite
  • HBaseRDDFunctionsSuite
  • TestJavaHBaseContext

As for the logs When I run "mvn -Dtest=NoUnitTests clean verify" I get the following files in my hbase-spark/surefire-reports/ folder.

Example I see "TEST-org.apache.hadoop.hbase.spark.HBaseContextSuite.xml"

I will upload a compressed bundle of what I see in that director.
Attachment example of what I see after I run mvn -Dtest=NoUnitTests clean verify

I was able to find target/surefire-reports/TEST-org.apache.hadoop.hbase.spark.HBaseContextSuite.xml after a good run.
However, it didn't contain any log related to hbase core.

On a side note something funky happen to hbase when I rebased. On my computer all the unit tests are broken in the master branch unless I do a "reverse look-up-able IP" to make it work. This issue is unrelated to my patch it was something else that change recently.

I get this error
java.io.IOException: java.lang.RuntimeException: Could not resolve Kerberos principal name: java.net.UnknownHostException: tmalaska-MBP-2.home: tmalaska-MBP-2.home: nodename nor servname provided, or not known

On a HBaseTestingUtility startMiniCluster

I have tested this on more then one computer with friends.

So repeat the patch should be good, but something is not good with HBase in the latest master with respeck to HBaseTestingUtility startMiniCluster

Ted Yu just brought this to my attention WRT HBASE-14594 which was recently applied.

Can you provide a command to run the tests that you see fail, Ted Malaska?

java.io.IOException: java.lang.RuntimeException: Could not resolve Kerberos principal name: java.net.UnknownHostException: tmalaska-MBP-2.home: tmalaska-MBP-2.home: nodename nor servname provided, or not known

Given that DNS is a central component to the kerberos security model, I'm surprise to hear you say that this ever worked for you before...

I just did "mvn -Dtest=NoUnitTests clean verify" in the hbase-spark folder

It totally worked before I rebased then I rebased and it didn't work.

I also got a fresh copy of master (so with out this patch) and I tried it on my box and two other people's boxes and all three failed.

The change in the host file was successful on one of the boxes to fix the problem. I will try to repeat the fix when I get home.

just brought this to my attention WRT HBASE-14594 which was recently applied.
